title: Total spend on third party agencies for the provision of supply staff by Sheffield City council

content:
Dear Sheffield City Council,
I would like to know how much each primary, secondary and SEND schools within Sheffield City Council (of which data is held) has spent on Supply Teaching or Teaching Assistant cover with external companies, and how much has been spent with each of those companies per school, ideally. If this information is not available, then just a total spend by school. If this could be presented in excel it would be appreciated
I would like this data from the 1st September 2023 - 31st July 2024 please?
Yours faithfully,
Mike Talbot

Dear Mike Talbot,
Thank you for your request for information relating to total spend on
third party agencies for the provision of supply staff in schools which we
received on 10/09/2024.
Please find Sheffield City Council’s response to your request set out
below:
We are unable to provide the information requested as schools manage their
own delegated budgets, and record transactions on the Schools Information
Management System (SIMS). The school accounts are uploaded to Integra
(which are consolidated into the council accounts and submitted to the
DfE) and summarised to CFR level. Details of individual transactions are
only held within the school’s own accounting system, so the school would
have to be contacted directly for more comprehensive information. There is
a list of Sheffield schools here: [1]Schools List January 2022
(sheffield.gov.uk).
If you have any queries about this response, please do not hesitate to
contact us.
The information provided in this response is available for re-use under
the terms of the Open Government Licence v3.0. The terms of the OGL can be
found [2]here. When re-using the information, Sheffield City Council
requires you to include the following attribution statement: “Contains
public sector information obtained from Sheffield City Council and
licensed under the Open Government Licence v3.0.”
If you are unhappy with the response you have received in relation to your
request, you are entitled to have this reviewed. You can ask for an
internal review by replying to this email. Internal review requests should
be submitted within 40 working days from the date of this response.
If you remain dissatisfied with the outcome of your internal review, you
can contact the Information Commissioner’s Office. Please see
[3]
https://ico.org.uk/make-a-complaint/offi...
for further details.
Kind Regards,
Sheffield City Council

Sheffield, S1 1UJ
